title: Admin. Executive (Student Care Centre)
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, Education and Training, Social Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to the Centre Manager, the incumbent for SCC Admin. Executive position will work closely with the Centre Manager to provide administration and operational support to BCARE Joy Connection (JOYC).
I Administration
1. General administrative duties including but not limited to the following:
a. Photocopy, draft letters/ WhatsApp’s broadcast messages to parents and filing of documents.
b. Update and maintain displays on notice boards.
c. Maintain and update student’s database and custody of documents.
d. Liaise with Finance pertaining to centre fee collection matters, issue receipts and monthly update excel
collection reports to Finance for reconciliation.
e. Ensure all forms are adequate and create new forms where necessary.
f. Apply SCFA and withdraw via the online SCFA portal.
g. Responsible for petty cash claims, month-end petty cash reports, and submitting the supporting to Finance.

2. Provide good customer service through:
a. Answer phone calls and attend to walk-ins.
Communicate/ liaise via WhatsApp or phone calls with parents, students, tutors and service providers.

3. Prepare reports and documents:
a. Monthly compilation of centre fees.
b. Weekly and monthly updates of students’ attendance schedules.

II Programmes
4. Fetch students from the school or designated pick-up point.

III Operations and General Maintenance
5. Monitor Centre cleanliness.
6. In charge of buying tea breaks and assisting in serving tea breaks and lunch.
7. Organise the storage space of the Centre with the help of teachers.
8. Replenish stationery, first aid box, ordering assessment books etc.
9. Manage facilities e.g. coordinate, liaise and schedule general repair, maintenance and upkeep of the
Centre e.g. air-cons, office equipment, fire extinguishers, housekeeping and storerooms.
10. Maintain and upkeep office equipment e.g. photocopier and desktops, projectors, telephones etc.

IV Others
11. Liaison for volunteer arrangements.
12. Work on any other areas that the Centre Manager may direct as and when necessary.

description:

1. Executive Support (50%)
Provide comprehensive secretarial and administrative support to the General Manager.
Efficiently manage and coordinate appointments, meetings, and conferences for the General Manager.
Handle all aspects of travel arrangements for the General Manager.
Prepare and submit monthly reports on the General Manager’s reimbursement and expenses claims.
Assist in personal research tasks when required, such as sourcing restaurant recommendations.

Maintain accurate digital and physical records and files.
Proactively manage office supplies, including ordering and replenishing inventory.
Oversee office relocation projects when necessary.
Facilitate the onboarding of new employees by preparing workspaces and necessary resources.
Accurately input data into relevant databases or systems.
Provide assistance and support in basic financial tasks, such as processing expense reports and issuing invoices.

Proven experience in a role involving executive support, office administration, or a similar capacity.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other office software.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational skills with a talent for multitasking effectively.
Unwavering attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining accuracy.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to overcoming challenges.
Demonstrated discretion and professionalism when handling confidential information.
Knowledge of basic accounting and bookkeeping principles is considered a valuable asset.

title: Sales Admin Officer (Game Industry) #JT
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Logistics / Supply Chain, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Our Client is a leading Japanese entertainment company, producer of collectible card games and trading cards. They are looking for a Sales Admin and Support Executive to join their team.

Responsible for day-to-day order management tasks and provide full spectrum of customer service and support to the distributors .

The Challenges:

Issuance of product sales solicitation sheet to relevant parties for new releases
Initiate and follow up new items/customers’ profiles creation in ERP system
Keep track of pre-order deadlines and send regular reminders to distributors
Acceptance of distributors’ orders and escalate if any abnormality found
Work closely with logistics team to plan and execute order fulfilment process
Sales order setup and maintain distributors’ orders in ERP system to ensure accuracy
Track payment and issue statement of accounts bi-monthly and ensure compliance with payment contractual terms
Collate and check monthly invoices against sales orders
Internal weekly sales reporting
Maintain internal pricing list based on product SRP and discount percentage
Update distributors’ mailing list when needed
Disseminate sales campaigns and any major announcements to distributors
Work closely with Marketing Team to promote USPs and sales campaigns for upcoming releases in order to generate bi-weekly newsletters for our distributors
Communicate closely with overseas branch offices and share vital information related to products and discuss distributors’ enquires if any
Local and Overseas events/shop visit support

What it Takes:
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s Degree qualification in any field of study
Strong team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Comfortable to communicate and work with overseas stakeholders
Have a basic understanding of the end-to-end supply chain
Proficient in dealing with numbers, tasks management and ideas generation
Possess positive attitude, with a mindset that strives for constant improvements
Ability to work independently and escalate issues effectively when required
Sensitive to cultural and linguistic nuances
Able to travel overseas for business conventions and events when required
Open to work on some weekends/public holidays for Company events
Interested Applicants, please submit a copy of your updated resume (in MS Word Format) and send to joshua@talentsatwork.sg

Talents@Work Pte Ltd (21C0501)
Telvin (R1113142)

title: Executive Officer (Admin & Publicity) - Fund Raising
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us: Muslimin Trust Fund Association (MTFA) is a rapidly growing nonprofit organisation committed to serving the underprivileged community in Singapore. With a focus on areas such as education, healthcare, welfare, and social services, MTFA aims to provide financial assistance and support to those in need. As our organisation continues to expand, we are dedicated to making a positive impact in the lives of those we serve.

Role Overview: The role of an Executive Officer (Admin & Publicity) at Muslimin Trust Fund Association's Fundraising department involves a diverse array of responsibilities. The primary focus is on handling publicity-related tasks and providing administrative support for fundraising assignments.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Publicity
Create and edit press releases, promotional materials, and articles.
Develop and execute publicity strategies and campaigns for fundraising.
Handle inquiries from the public, media, and affiliated organisations.
Conduct market research and recommend improvements.
Design and produce presentations and promotional content.
Collaborate with the MTFA Publicity Team on media-related activities.
Prepare media evaluation reports and assist in event organisation.
Design promotional collaterals and maintain the department's website.
Capture and archive photographs from fundraising events.
2. Administrative
Address inquiries related to fundraising activities.
Assist in fundraising assignments by liaising with relevant stakeholders and managing administrative tasks.
Oversee the preparation and submission of required documents.
Coordinate logistics such as transportation and communication with external parties.
Generate and maintain reports related to fundraising efforts.
Contribute to quality management and data protection initiatives.
Manage financial transactions related to fundraising activities.
Assist in procurement and inventory management for fundraising materials.
REQUIREMENTS
Diploma/Degree in Administrative, Marketing, Public Relations, Mass Communication, or related fields.
Proficiency in marketing communications, branding, design, and social media management.
Strong command of the English language (spoken and written).
Adaptability to fast-paced environments and administration tasks.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant working experience.
Prior knowledge of the fundraising and publicity industry is advantageous.
Proficiency in social media and website management.
Join Muslimin Trust Fund Association in our mission to provide compassionate and dignified fundraising efforts to those in need. As an Executive Officer, you'll play a vital role in supporting our cause and ensuring the success of our initiatives. Join us in making a difference in the lives of those we serve during challenging times.

title: Executive Officer (Admin & Publicity) - Ihsan Casket
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About MTFA
The Muslimin Trust Fund Association (MTFA) is a charity committed to supporting the underprivileged in our community through a myriad of services, including but not limited to offering shelter to orphans and youths at risk, facilitating subsidized medical treatments, and administering financial aid through various programs.

Guided by our principle of "Towards a sincere pursuit of Ihsan", we aim to continuously create positive impacts within the communities we serve.

Job Summary

We are looking to recruit a diligent and dedicated Executive Officer (Admin & Publicity) for our Ihsan Casket department at the Muslimin Trust Fund Association. In this multifaceted role, your focus will be on efficiently managing administrative tasks related to burial assignments and spearheading publicity initiatives. If you have a background in administration, marketing, or public relations along with a passion for serving the community, this could be the perfect opportunity for you to shine.

Key Responsibilities
Publicity
Strategy and Campaign Planning: Develop and execute strategic publicity campaigns for MTFA Burial/Ihsan Casket.
Media Relations: Serve as the primary contact for media inquiries, fostering strong relationships with journalists and media outlets.
Content Creation: Create and edit a variety of content, including press releases, brochures, and social media posts, ensuring consistency and coherence with the brand's image.
Events and Fundraising: To lead the organisation of events, courses, and fundraising campaigns to bolster the image and services of Ihsan Casket and MTFA Burial.
Digital Media Management: Regularly update the Ihsan Casket website and social media platforms, keeping the public informed about our services and initiatives.
Administrative
Client and Stakeholder Liaison: Be the primary point of contact for inquiries and maintain relations with stakeholders, including contractors and other casket companies.
Documentation and Reporting: Manage all necessary documentation for burial assignments and generate regular reports to keep the executive team informed.
Operational Support: Provide operational support for burial services, ensuring a dignified and compassionate approach in line with company policies.
Financial Management: Oversee financial transactions, including the processing of invoices and managing petty cash.
Training Administration: Administer the Jenazah Management Course, including the preparation of materials and issuance of certificates.
Qualifications
A diploma or degree in Administrative, Marketing, Public Relations, Mass Communication, or a related field.
A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience, preferably in the marketing or publicity sector.
Proficiency in various areas including social media and website management, branding, and project management.
Excellent command of the English and Malay languages, both written and spoken.
Competencies
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.
Experience with market research and fundraising.
Adept at multitasking in a fast-paced environment.
Strong administrative support skills.
Understanding of ISO 9001:2015 QMS standards.
Reporting Structure
The Executive Officer will be an integral member of the fundraising department, reporting directly to the Ihsan Casket Manager, with collaborative engagements across various departments.

Working Conditions
Office Hours: 8:30 am - 5:30 pm (Mon - Thur)
Office Hours: 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (Fri)
Office Location: 5 Mattar Road
Flexibility for remote work engagements, in accordance with MTFA's remote work policy.
Career Development Opportunities
Opportunities for career growth within the organisation, with potential advancements to managerial roles within the Ihsan Casket department.
Access to training and development programs to further enhance skills and competencies.
Application Process
Interested candidates should send their resumé along with a cover letter demonstrating their suitability for the role to MTFA human resource department. Please ensure to include examples of past experience in fundraising or administrative roles.
